comment.body: :O
@Musickiller: @ZAlex: Well, in theory you could add a function like ZeroMe has (and ThunderWave as well :D), so that the user could press a download-button
@ZAlex: xD
@ZAlex: O-Kay x'D
@ZAlex: lol, exactly in the same second O_O

@Krixano: @Nicolai Ireneo-Larsen: For links pointing to zites on ZeroNet, I recommend _not_ putting the protocol (`http://`) and host:port (e.g. `127.0.0.1:43110`) in front of the url, but just the `/`, so e.g.:
`[ThunderWave](/thunderwave.bit/)`

@ZAlex: Whoa!
That looks really sick O_O
I have merged 28 hubs through [this zite](/0hub.bit/) and still can't read any chinese.
It looks very nice! Especially with the shadows :D
Hi, and yes, it is :)
It might just be a recorded television, but I'm sure it's the original.
Congratulations on that :)
Not dev-branch anymore or what?!
@Musickiller: Happy B-Day :)

@Nofish: There could also be an option for setting a post as optional.. that way users don't have to delete their posts (or, to think the other way around, when a user has no more space left, all following posts could be put into optional files)

Or do optional files actually count as used space?
Oh wow, that is quite good-looking!
@Musickiller: I think he meant "grats" as in "congratulations"

Don't die. :)
I don't wish good luck, because that would mean that you actually need luck.
So slick-looking graphs O_O
As if Microsoft bought GitHub
Maybe because he set his name to `styromaniac@zeroid.bit` and ZeroMe doesn't know who to @ :?
Well you could add the mention-stuff manually via console.. But I'm not sure if that persists throughout ZeroNet-restarts and such.
@Musickiller: Well I did have to try out stuff when I was working on the ZeroHello-Feed feature for ThunderWave, but I only tested that while on Desktop ..
@Musickiller: You might be able to start a debug-session through your Desktop's Browser, but I'm not sure (I think I once did this with Chrome, but I've got absolutely no idea how I did it)
